column3: proved incorrect as you increased the number of simulations?:

column1: With a small number of simulations of 10
column2: france having no chance of winnning was incorrect.

column1: With 100 simulations France had an 8% chance of winning so was most correct.
Increased from 1000 simulations onwards the chance of France winning lowered to 3.5%.
Suppose you're charged a fee for each second of compute time your program uses.
After how many simulations would you call the predictions "good enough"?:
If charged a fee for each SECOND of compute time the program uses
